conclusion: Analyze energy loss due to inelastic collision and air resistance effect.
Basketball is dropped from height H and rebounds to height h.
Initial potential energy at height H is PE_i = mgH.
Potential energy converts to kinetic energy just before impact: KE_i = 1/2 mv_i^2 = mgH.
Final potential energy at height h is PE_f = mgh.
Post-collision kinetic energy is KE_f = 1/2 mv_f^2 = mgh.
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is v_f/v_i = sqrt(h/H).
Air resistance force is lambda mg, with 0 < lambda < (H-h)/(H+h).
Work done by air resistance reduces mechanical energy.
Ratio of velocities remains same due to consistent air resistance effect.
Final velocity ratio is v_f/v_i = sqrt(h/H).
Final answer: Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is sqrt(h/H).
